Package org.svvrl.goal.core.aut

Class RandomAutomaton<T extends Automaton>

java.lang.Object
org.svvrl.goal.core.AbstractGenerator<T>
org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.AbstractRandomAutomaton<T>
org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.RandomAutomaton<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of generated automata
All Implemented Interfaces:
Generator<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
RandomFSA, RandomGame
public abstract class RandomAutomaton<T extends Automaton>
extends AbstractRandomAutomaton<T>
This is a generator of random automata.
Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai

      public static final java.lang.String O_SIMULATION
      Indicates if the generated automaton should be simplified based on direct and reverse simulation relations.

    • O_FAIR_SIMULATION

      public static final java.lang.String O_FAIR_SIMULATION
      Indicates if the generated automaton should be simplified based on fair relation.

    • O_COUNT_SIMPLIFIED

      public static final java.lang.String O_COUNT_SIMPLIFIED
      Match the desired size of states after simplifying the generated automaton. The simplification applied depends on #O_REDUCE and #O_SIMPLIFY.

  • Constructor Details

    • RandomAutomaton

      public RandomAutomaton()
      Constructs this generator.

  • Method Details

    • createAutomaton

      protected abstract T createAutomaton​(AlphabetType type, Position position)
      Creates a new automaton.
      Parameters:
      type - the alphabet type of the created automaton
      position - the label position of the created automaton
      Returns:
      an empty automaton with the specified alphabet type and label position

    • generate

      public T generate() throws GenerationException
      Generates a random finite state automaton.
      Returns:
      a finite state automaton generated randomly
      Throws:
      GenerationException - if the type of the acceptance condition is not supported or the maximal number of trials is reached but the transition density or the acceptance density cannot be satisfied
